column4: how do I restore my x server settings after it's borked when I upgrade to a new version of Ubuntu?
I'm not sure, I just ran the upgrade program
did you have a lot of custom configurations?
I think it's backed up, I'm just not sure where
if you can find it, that would be best, else, sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
where is the config file located?
so do I just rename one of my backup files to xorg.conf?
then restart the x server, yup
it was premature...x loads but gnome doesn't, so I'm stuck with  my desktop background and nothing else
I'll be honest, I have to get up in 5.5hrs, I'm not going to be alert long enough to fix this- let me phone a friend
